item.title: Amazon's Tomb Raider Show Reveals More Cast Members Including Jason Isaacs and More
item.content:encoded:
Amazon has revealed more cast members for the upcoming Tomb Raider TV show, and there are more than a few legendary faces joining the series, including celebrated British actors like Jason Isaacs and Bill Paterson.

As revealed by Amazon, the show will include iconic Tomb Raider characters like Lara Croft's butler Winston, her uncle Atlas DeMornay (who you can meet as part of the so-called Survivor Trilogy), and Zip, who made his debut as part of the Legend sub-series.

DeMornay will be portrayed by Jason Isaacs, best known for roles like Lucius Malfoy in the Harry Potter movies and General Zhukov in The Death of Stalin. Winston, meanwhile, will be played by Bill Paterson, who you may know as House of the Dragon's Lyman Beesbury or the father in Fleabag.

They're joined by screen legend Sigourney Weaver, who will be portraying "mysterious, high-flying woman" Evelyn Wallis, ostensibly a new character created for the show. Since Weaver is playing her, though, you can expect her to be a major player, and I'd be shocked if she wasn't the main antagonist of the series.

Another British icon joining Tomb Raider is Celia Imrie, who will play the British Museum's "Head of Advancement" Francine. She, according to Amazon, is "focused solely on raising funds and glasses of champagne".

Sadly, we still don't have a release date for the Tomb Raider TV show, but we do know it'll be headed up by Fleabag's Phoebe Waller-Bridge and that Game of Thrones star Sophie Turner will be portraying Lara Croft. Production for the show will begin on January 19th.

It's been all go in the world of Tomb Raider recently; not only is the show moving ahead at full pelt, but two - yes, two - new Tomb Raider games were announced during this year's Game Awards. One's a remake of the original Tomb Raider and the other is an all-new title.

We'll likely get more information about the Tomb Raider TV show, including a release date, later this year, and more details about the two aforementioned games will probably be forthcoming as well. Stay tuned for more.

Joe has been writing for TechRaptor for several years, and in those years has learned a lot about the gaming industry and its foibles. He’s originally an… More about Joseph
